title: Remove overwriting of default KernelManager
body: Fixes https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/issues/1964 unless I am missing some context.

title: nbconvert ignores ExecuteProcessor.timeout with jupyter_client>=8
body:
## How to reproduce

In a fresh environment created with:

      conda create -n bad nbconvert ipykernel

Run:

      jupyter-nbconvert --execute --ExecutePreprocessor.timeout=1  Rapport.ipynb

On the attached notebook having cell with a `sleep(40)`.

## Expected

The execution of the cell would be interrupted after one second, as in the following environment

      conda create -n good nbconvert ipykernel "jupyter_client<8"

## Got

The execution of the cell is not interrupted.

## Additional info

Refining the dichotomy, the error occurs when upgrading between versions 7.4.9 and 8.0.1
of jupyter_client (there is no intermediate version on conda-forge).

## Details

title: Do not import pyppeteer for installation check (#1947)
body: Should fix #1944 because `importlib.util.find_spec` does not import the package.

title: Fix handling of css sanitizer
body: Address warning `'style' attribute specified, but css_sanitizer not set.`

title: always pass relax_add_props=True when validating
body:
avoids crashing on notebooks that have no practical issues.

I think the relevant deprecation was a mistake, and is reverted in https://github.com/jupyter/nbformat/pull/343 because it's not related to normalization, and https://github.com/jupyter/nbformat/pull/282 deprecated normalization args passed to validate.

title: Fix Hanging Tests on Linux
body:
The tests are hanging on downstream tests, e.g. https://github.com/ipython/traitlets/actions/runs/3722005188/jobs/6312540850.

Reason: Both PyQtWebEngine and Pyppeteer are hanging on Ubuntu 22.04, which is now the default runner.  

Pyppeteer is deprecated, but I was unsuccessful in #1919 in trying to replace it with Playwright, due to having problems installing properly in CI.

Either way, we no longer require webpdf for the base testing, so we're not relying on external binaries.

title: Fix for webpdf print margins
body: This is a fix for the webpdf print margins. It adds 0.5 inch margins to each printed page. This fixes Issue #1660

title: clean_html: allow SVG tags and SVG attributes
body:
Fixes https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/issues/1849
Refs https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/pull/1854

title: Fix version handling
body: Match what is done in `ipykernel`.

title: fix markdown table not render bug
body: no default plugins for `mistune.Markdown` for mistune update to v2, I added default plugins to `MarkdownWithMath` class

title: Backport: Fix title
body: Backport #1832 against 6.x

title: Fix title
body:
`clean_html` returns valid HTML (wrapping the input around `

`) so we should not use it for the title or anything that's not HTML. Instead we can safely escape the HTML while keeping quotes. ### before ![Screenshot from 2022-08-11 10-01-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/184090144-7f76a096-ad2f-451c-9779-5f0398177c9f.png) ### after ![Screenshot from 2022-08-11 10-03-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/184090171-e6914c63-784e-41ee-bdd4-148c4c496ec3.png)

title: escape_html: prevent escaping quotes on widgets JSON reprs (#1829)
body:
Forward port of https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/pull/1829

* escape_html: prevent escaping quotes

This fixes an issue in Voila and the ipywidgets's HTMLManager for widgets support

* Add method for escaping html while keeping quotes

For escaping HTML from JSON reprs

title: escape_html: prevent escaping quotes
body:
This fixes an issue in Voila and the ipywidgets's HTMLManager for widgets support https://github.com/voila-dashboards/voila/issues/1186

Escaping quotes in the widget view mimetype being:
```
{"version_major": 2, "version_minor": 0, "model_id": "3b69871380984eae832c53f5ba8afa56"}
```

Breaking the JSON representation of the widget in the Notebook

title: Fix handling of BlockParser
body: The API is changing is Mistune 3.0.  See failure in https://github.com/jupyter-server/jupyter_server/runs/7318374063?check_suite_focus=true.

title: Since 6.0 Markdown in HTML divs render as LaTeX instead of being skipped

labels.name: format:HTML
labels.description: pertains to exporting to the HTML format

body:
In 5.6.1, markdown inside HTML `
` tags was skipped in the nbconvert HTML output, which is not ideal, but was still readable. Since upgrading to 6.0, I have noticed that they are rendered as LaTeX math. In many cases, this makes the text ineligible, so this is quite a big issue (but possible to workaround by using HTML inside the div instead of markdown, although this means the same notebook can't be exported to both PDF and HTML without modifications). As an example, the following code ````html
Testing HTML with `inline code` tags.
``` I am a code block ```
```` Would show up like this (and [still does on GH](https://github.com/joelostblom/nbc-html-test/blob/master/Untitled.ipynb), which I guess has not update to 6.0) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4560057/93689200-08961480-fa81-11ea-9267-d1685bfcd127.png) But since 6.0, it shows up like this ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4560057/93689170-ccfb4a80-fa80-11ea-93ff-e708076e6612.png) ``` jupyter core : 4.6.3 jupyter-notebook : 6.1.4 qtconsole : not installed ipython : 7.18.1 ipykernel : 5.3.4 jupyter client : 6.1.7 jupyter lab : 2.2.6 nbconvert : 6.0.3 ipywidgets : not installed nbformat : 5.0.5 traitlets : 5.0.4 ``` For reference to the old skipping behavior, these are the currently open HTML markdown related issues: - https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/issues/1037 - https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/issues/1165 - https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/issues/1146 - https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/issues/1125

  File "c:\miniconda37-x64\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\zmq\sugar\socket.py", line 67, in __del__
  File "c:\miniconda37-x64\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\zmq\_future.py", line 160, in close
  File "c:\miniconda37-x64\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\zmq\asyncio\__init__.py", line 60, in _clear_io_state
  File "c:\miniconda37-x64\envs\test-environment\lib\asyncio\events.py", line 504, in remove_reader
NotImplementedError: 
```

This looks related to, e.g., https://github.com/jupyter/notebook/issues/4613, https://github.com/jupyter/notebook/pull/5047, https://github.com/jupyter/notebook/issues/5094, or https://github.com/jupyterhub/jupyterhub/pull/3123.


<!--- Can you, if possible, please attach a minimum notebook that reproduces this issue on conversion?
You may need to attach the .ipynb as a .txt --->
https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/blob/master/lib/matplotlib/tests/test_nbagg_01.ipynb

<!--- Are you running the latest version of nbconvert? --->
**Nbconvert version:** 6.0.1

title: nbconvert 6 doesn't run `preprocess_cell` with ExecuteProcessor
body:
With the latest nbconvert from pypi, `preprocess_cell` in subclasses of `ExecuteProcessor` no longer run. Looking at the source, I can see that nothing is calling `preprocess_cell` any more.

I'm not sure if this is a bug, a missing feature, or a question... It at least appears to be some missing documentation.

Can you please advise how, in nbconvert v6 / nbclient, you recommend executing a notebook (without saving it) and preprocessing each cell before executing?

(More generally, I'm totally overwhelmed at all the things that have broken in nbdev with nbconvert v6, and I'm only finding the answers by looking at the source code for v6 and commit logs. Is there anywhere I could find an 'upgrade guide', and/or a list of API changes? I've read the release notes, but they don't show many of the changes.)

title: Handle ValueErrors raised by get_exporter
body:
Fixes  #1366

```bash
$ python -m jupyterlab.browser_check
...
[I 2020-09-10 06:05:49.817 ServerApp] Test Complete
[I 2020-09-10 06:05:49.817 ServerApp] Exiting normally
[I 2020-09-10 06:05:49.817 ServerApp] Stopping server..
```

title: Handle missing templates
body:
<!--- Description --->
In unit tests, we typically override the Jupyter [environment variables](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab/blob/9c5252392fa671949d67fe5aa2b83c78144e066b/jupyterlab/tests/test_app.py#L108) for isolation.  
We are seeing errors due to missing templates as a result.

<!--- Can you list steps to reproduce this issue? --->
- `pip install -U jupyterlab nbconvert`
- `python -m jupyterlab.browser_check`

```python

    for path in map(Path, self.template_paths):

title: Built-in Reveal.js themes seem to incorrectly display background

labels.name: format:Slides
labels.description: pertains to exporting to the Slides format

body:
<!--- Description --->
When using many of the built-in reveal.js slide themes (black.css, solarized.css, moon.css), the background of the presentation stays white. Strangely, using sky.css correctly displays a colored background.

I am using MacOS Catalina 10.15.4. This problem occurs in Safari, Firefox, and Chrome.

Below is the HTML tags that I'm using to load the theme. The file is generated from a Jupyter notebook using `jupyter nbconvert file.ipynb --to slides --SlidesExporter.reveal_theme=moon`. I hope I am not missing something - I looked elsewhere in the slides.html file, and didn't see any obvious place where the background color was being overwritten.

```html
<script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/require.js/2.1.10/require.min.js"></script>
<script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.0.3/jquery.min.js"></script>

<!-- General and theme style sheets -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/reveal.js/3.5.0/css/reveal.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/reveal.js/3.5.0/css/theme/solarized.css" id="theme">
```
<!--- Can you list steps to reproduce this issue? --->

<!--- Can you, if possible, please attach a minimum notebook that reproduces this issue on conversion?
You may need to attach the .ipynb as a .txt --->

<!--- Can you attach screenshots if relevant? --->

<!--- Are you running the latest version of nbconvert? --->
**Nbconvert version: 5.6.1**

title: How am I supposed to use new template system?
body:
I have this:
```
class MyMdExporter(TemplateExporter):
    file_extension = ".md"
    template_file = "markdown/index.md.j2"
```

But it fails since in the file `index.md.j2`, there's an `{% extends display_priority.j2 %}` instead of `{% extends base/display_priority.j2 }%` (and also recursively, in `display_priority.j2`, the reference to `null.j2`}
```
jinja2.exceptions.TemplateNotFound: display_priority.j2
```

What I did is this:
```
diff --git a/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/base/display_priority.j2 b/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/base/display_priority.j2
index beaa196a..56ad7cde 100644
--- a/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/base/display_priority.j2
+++ b/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/base/display_priority.j2
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-{%- extends 'null.j2' -%}
+{%- extends 'base/null.j2' -%}
 
 {#display data priority#}
 
diff --git a/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/markdown/index.md.j2 b/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/markdown/index.md.j2
index 8906eff8..f4421520 100644
--- a/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/markdown/index.md.j2
+++ b/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/markdown/index.md.j2
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-{% extends 'display_priority.j2' %}
+{% extends 'base/display_priority.j2' %}
 
 
 {% block in_prompt %}
```

Is it correct? Or do I need to copy the `markdown/index.md.j2` into `compatibility/markdown.tpl`?

title: AttributeError in .start_kernel()
body:
An `AttributeError` occurs when trying to test out jupyter kernels using `ExecutePreprocessor.start_new_kernel()`. With a freshly downloaded and updated anaconda environment (package versions listed below), I just run this as a python script ```python from nbconvert.preprocessors import ExecutePreprocessor ep = ExecutePreprocessor() km, kc = ep.start_new_kernel(kernel_name='working') km.shutdown_kernel() ``` and it returns this traceback ``` Traceback (most recent call last): File "test_kernel.py", line 4, in km, kc = ep.start_new_kernel(kernel_name='python3') File "/marconi_work/FUA33_SOLBOUT3/tnichola/anaconda3/envs/working/lib/python3.7/site-packages/nbconvert/preprocessors/execute.py", line 285, in start_new_kernel self.kernel_name = self.nb.metadata.get( AttributeError: 'ExecutePreprocessor' object has no attribute 'nb' ``` `jupyter kernelspec list` returns ``` Available kernels: build_central /marconi/home/userexternal/tnichola/.local/share/jupyter/kernels/build_central py37 /marconi/home/userexternal/tnichola/.local/share/jupyter/kernels/py37 py37.2 /marconi/home/userexternal/tnichola/.local/share/jupyter/kernels/py37.2 python3 /marconi_work/FUA33_SOLBOUT3/tnichola/anaconda3/envs/working/share/jupyter/kernels/python3 ``` and I've tried passing `kernel_name='python3'`, 'build_central' and leaving it blank. nbconvert version: 5.6.1

title: nbconvert failed: [Errno 13] Permission denied
body:
I've been trying to figure out the root cause of this for a while, but I can't see what's wrong with our config. When trying to export a notebook as PDF from JupyterLab I am getting a permission denied error:

```
[userA@host1 ~]$ jupyter nbconvert --to pdf Untitled.ipynb
(...)
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/latex/article.tplx'
```

`/software/jupyterhub` is where we deployed JupyterLab and `share/jupyter` is in the data path, but I don't understand why `~/.local/share/jupyter` isn't tried first:

```
[userA@host1 ~]$ jupyter --path
config:
    /home/userA/.jupyter
    /software/jupyterhub/etc/jupyter
    /usr/local/etc/jupyter
    /etc/jupyter
data:
    /home/userA/.local/share/jupyter
    /software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter
    /usr/local/share/jupyter
    /usr/share/jupyter
runtime:
    /home/userA/.local/share/jupyter/runtime

[userA@host1 software]$ jupyter --data-dir
/home/userA/.local/share/jupyter
```

If `/software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter` exists and is writeable to `userA`, the directories `nbconvert/templates/latex` get created and the conversion works (but only for `userA`):

```
[userA@host1 ~]$ ls -l /software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/
total 152
drwxr-sr-x. 13 swuser  common 301 Jan 13 12:48 kernels
drwxr-sr-x.  8 swuser  common 181 Jan 10 14:25 lab
drwxr-sr-x.  4 swuser  common  62 Jan 13 09:47 nbextensions

[userA@host1 ~]$ touch /software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/test_rw

[userA@host1 ~]$ jupyter nbconvert --to pdf Untitled.ipynb
[NbConvertApp] Converting notebook Untitled.ipynb to pdf
(...)
[NbConvertApp] PDF successfully created
[NbConvertApp] Writing 28002 bytes to Untitled.pdf

[userA@host1 ~]$ ls -l /software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/
total 152
drwxr-sr-x. 13 swuser  common 301 Jan 13 12:48 kernels
drwxr-sr-x.  8 swuser  common 181 Jan 10 14:25 lab
drwxrwsr-x.  3 userA   common  27 Jan 14 15:17 nbconvert
drwxr-sr-x.  4 swuser  common  62 Jan 13 09:47 nbextensions
-rw-rw-r--.  1 userA   common   0 Jan 14 15:18 test_rw

[userA@host1 ~]$ ls -lR /software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/nbconvert/
/software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/nbconvert/:
total 32
drwxrwsr-x. 3 userA  common 23 Jan 14 15:17 templates

/software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates:
total 32
drwx--S---. 2 userA  common 0 Jan 14 15:17 latex

/software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter/nbconvert/templates/latex:
total 0
```

If `/software/jupyterhub/share/jupyter` is NOT writeable to `userA`, nbconvert works for all users as expected.

Any ideas?

title: Document or remove dependence of RegExRemove Processor on outputs
body:
The `RegExRemoveProcessor` removes cells if they match the given regular expression and have no output.

This is not made clear in the docstring, but feels like surprising behavior to me. I often want to remove cells based only on their contents, not on whether they have outputs, and in fact often want to remove cells that produce outputs, e.g. solution cells in an educational notebook. As it stands, without looking at the source, there is no way to know that the outputs of the cell influence this preprocessor, which makes debugging difficult. My current work-around is to use the `ClearOutputPreprocessor` first, but that won't work if I need to preserve some, but not all, outputs.

If that is expected and desired behavior, it should be noted [here, in the docstring](https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/blob/2e0baa25160ebf342f798198a28ee5364ebcd4fa/nbconvert/preprocessors/regexremove.py#L20), perhaps by changing the linked line to:

```
    of unicode strings. If the contents match any of the patterns and the cell
    has no outputs, the cell is removed from the notebook.
```

But I would personally prefer the behavior in [this version](https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/blame/3860a848ccfde8e86f5b278fe85177f8786c663c/nbconvert/preprocessors/regexremove.py), which simply removes cells that match, or a flag to switch between the two behaviors.

**Nbconvert version:** Any after a8cb3a5, linked above (.

Thanks for making a box of really nice tools! Couldn't effectively teach without them.

title: Colored Text Crashes PDF Export
body:
<!--- Description --->

Printing colored text results in latex conversion when exporting to pdf that fail to process by xelatex.

<!--- Can you list steps to reproduce this issue? --->

Executing and then exporting via `jupyter nbconvet --to=pdf ColorExportFail`
```
from colorama import Fore, Back, Style 
print(Fore.RED + 'red')
```

Raises an exception:
```
! FancyVerb Error:
  Empty verbatim environment
.
\FV@Error ...ncyVerb Error:^^J\space \space #1^^J}
                                                  
l.381 }\end{Verbatim}
```

Just exporting the latex via `jupyter nbconvet --to=latex ColorExportFail` produces
```
    \begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\textcolor{ansi-red}{red
}\end{Verbatim}
```

Instead of
```
    \begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\textcolor{ansi-red}{red}
\end{Verbatim}
```
The extra newline breaks exports.

<!--- Can you, if possible, please attach a minimum notebook that reproduces this issue on conversion?
You may need to attach the .ipynb as a .txt --->

[ColorExportFail.txt](https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/files/3439599/ColorExportFail.txt)

<!--- Can you attach screenshots if relevant? --->

<!--- Are you running the latest version of nbconvert? --->
This is on current master (5.5.0)

title: Periodic Test Failure
body:
Seeing this error a lot in CI builds if someone could dig into why this inconsistently passes / fails.

```
=================================== FAILURES ===================================
______________________ TestNbConvertApp.test_allow_errors ______________________
self = <nbconvert.tests.test_nbconvertapp.TestNbConvertApp testMethod=test_allow_errors>
    def test_allow_errors(self):
        """
        Verify that conversion is aborted with '--execute' if an error is
        encountered, but that conversion continues if '--allow-errors' is
        used in addition.
        """
        with self.create_temp_cwd(['notebook3*.ipynb']):
            # Convert notebook containing a cell that raises an error,
            # both without and with cell execution enabled.
            output1, _ = self.nbconvert('--to markdown --stdout notebook3*.ipynb')  # no cell execution
            output2, _ = self.nbconvert('--to markdown --allow-errors --stdout notebook3*.ipynb')  # no cell execution; --allow-errors should have no effect
            output3, _ = self.nbconvert('--execute --allow-errors --to markdown --stdout notebook3*.ipynb')  # with cell execution; errors are allowed
    
            # Un-executed outputs should not contain either
            # of the two numbers computed in the notebook.
            assert '23' not in output1
            assert '42' not in output1
            assert '23' not in output2
            assert '42' not in output2
    
            # Executed output should contain both numbers.
            assert '23' in output3
>           assert '42' in output3
E           AssertionError: assert '42' in '\n# Notebook with errors\n\nThis notebook contains a cell which deliberately throws an exception. This is to test if ...n\n```python\nprint("The answer to the question about life, the universe and everything is: {}".format(43 - 1))\n```\n'
/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.6.7/lib/python3.6/site-packages/nbconvert/tests/test_nbconvertapp.py:382: AssertionError
```

title: html dedent for markdown export
body:
nbconvert doesn't dedent 'text/html' outputs, which leads to errors down the line (specifically when converting notebooks that use plotly to Markdown).

To exemplify this issue, convert any notebook that uses plotly to markdown and you'll see the plotly js code (that came from a text/html output cell output -- but was indented) is displayed as verbatim rather than executed.
Given that HTML is dedent invariant (that was awkward to write) it seems like the reader should dedent by default?

I started digging into the code, but wasn't sure where would be the best place to add this. Is this something you all would be into? I can write a pull request, I just need to know where would be a sane place for it?

title: Nbconvert silences errors if a pdf is successfully produced

labels.name: format:PDF
labels.description: pertains to exporting to the PDF format

body:
In the event that LaTeX throws an error but still produces a pdf, no error is displayed to the user. This makes diagnosing what caused LaTeX to stop part way very difficult. See #893 and #797

Currently, to find this error, a user must export to LaTeX and compile it themselves so LaTeX will display the error.

title: pytest appears to be a runtime dependency
body: Running `nbconvert` from source, it seems that `nbconvert/utils/io.py` imports `pytest` since PR https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/pull/758

title: Fix getting pandoc version number
body:
Allowing for non-ascii home directory on Windows. We only need to decode the first line, not the whole output.

Closes gh-621

title: Don't pass Latex output through md->tex conversion for latex output

labels.name: format:LaTeX
labels.description: pertains to exporting to the LaTeX format

body: Closes gh-534

title: Fix to allow invalidating the cached Jinja environment with recent traitlets
body: New versions of traitlets now always pass an argument, so it failed without the argument. This was already fixed for the template cache.

title: Use upright quotes for code in LaTeX

labels.name: format:LaTeX
labels.description: pertains to exporting to the LaTeX format

body: I'm not quite sure if that's the right fix, but at least it seems to fix the problem.

title: Totally broken by recent change to traitlets
body:
The default value for `Type` when no default specified changed from `None` to `object`, to make validation more consistent. However, nbconvert relies on the default for `NbconvertApp.postprocessor_factory` being None (or Falsy, at least).

This is simple to fix, I'm just contemplating the best way to do it.
